content:
=== Game Rules ===
Game rules in natural language:
Here’s a plain‐language breakdown of what’s going on in the game:

1. Game Genre and Overall Feel:
 • It’s a tile‐based, puzzle–action game that has a bit of a platformer or “spelunky” vibe. You control an “avatar” character in a maze-like environment filled with obstacles, enemies, and collectible resources. Think of it as an adventure where you must navigate hazards and gather items while timing your moves carefully.

2. Key Game Components and Mechanics:
 • Sprites and Tiles: The game world is built out of different sprites. For example, “wall” and “dirt” form parts of the level’s terrain, “boulder” objects act like falling hazards (missiles), and “exitdoor” is your way out.
 • The Avatar: You control the avatar (depicted as a spelunky-type character) who can “shoot” a sword. This sword isn’t just a weapon—it seems to interact with other sprites (for instance, it “kills” dirt, which may help clear obstacles).
 • Collectibles and Score: Diamonds are scattered around the levels. Touching a diamond triggers a resource collection interaction and increases your score.
 • Enemies and Hazards: There are different enemy types (like “enemy,” “crab,” and “butterfly”). Some enemies have interesting interactions (for example, a butterfly meeting a crab transforms it into a diamond and bumps your score up). Boulders can kill the avatar if you aren’t careful, though hitting them from above might do something different (it says “killIfFromAbove” with a score penalty).
 • Doors and Winning: The exit door isn’t a simple door—it comes with a twist. When your avatar touches it, the door “kills” the avatar if you haven’t met a particular resource (diamond) requirement (it checks a limit of 9). In other words, you must collect enough diamonds before you’re allowed to escape. Also, once you’ve used the exit door (it’s “killed”), that triggers your win condition for the level.

3. Objective and Win/Loss Conditions:
 • The main goal is to safely guide your avatar through the level, collecting enough diamonds (at least 9, based on the exit door’s rule) and then reach the exit door to win.
 • You lose if your avatar is destroyed (for example, by boulders, enemies, or unwise actions with hazards).
 • You win when the exit door is “cleared” (removed) because you’ve met its conditions, meaning you successfully collected enough diamonds and navigated through the threats.

4. A Suggested Overall Strategy:
 • Explore Carefully and Collect: Roam through the level methodically. Prioritize collecting diamonds to meet the requisite count before attempting to exit.
 • Manage Hazards: Watch out for boulders that fall (they move downward slowly). Time your movements so that you avoid being hit, and if possible, use the upward hit rule to your advantage.
 • Use the Sword Wisely: The sword isn’t just for attacking enemies—it also interacts with terrain like dirt, maybe allowing you to clear paths. Use it to eliminate minor obstacles while being cautious around enemies.
 • Exploit Enemy Interactions: Some enemies interact with each other. For example, colliding crabs and butterflies result in transformations that yield extra diamonds and points. Try to lure or maneuver enemies into one another if you can.
 • Don’t Rush the Exit: Only head for the exit door once you’re sure you’ve got the minimum number of diamonds (or have met the score/resource requirement) so that the door won’t “kill” your avatar on contact.
 • Stay Alert: With various moving elements (like boulders and roaming NPCs), keep a constant eye on your surroundings. Sometimes, a careful pause or a backtrack can save you from an avoidable death.

In summary, you’re in a dynamic, puzzle-action adventure where careful movement, resource collection, and using the environment (and enemy interactions) to your advantage are key. Plan your route, collect enough diamonds, dispatch or avoid dangerous hazards, and then exit safely to win the level.

You are an intelligent player playing a video game, and you have a friend provide you strategy. Interpret the state, rule, strategy and act accordingly. Notice that your avatar position is one of the most important information, if the position doesn't change from the last state, you need to analyze the state and make a different action from the last time.

=== Available Actions ===
0: ACTION_NIL
1: ACTION_USE
2: ACTION_LEFT
3: ACTION_RIGHT
4: ACTION_DOWN
5: ACTION_UP

=== Feedback === 


Evaluation: BAD 
Feedback: The action (interpreted as a directional move that failed to change the avatar’s location) did not contribute to progressing toward the exit or obtaining useful items and thus provided no strategic benefit, maintaining a reward of 0.0 from the environment.

=== Important Mechanics Notice ===
 In some games, directional actions (LEFT, RIGHT, UP, DOWN) may first cause the avatar to rotate toward the intended direction without immediately moving. If the avatar's position does not change after a directional action, it may indicate a rotation has occurred. To proceed, you must apply the directional action again after rotation. Always verify whether the avatar actually moved after each action. Please understand the rule and the interaction set first, then locate the item, finally choose a meaningful action towards the win and respond in the format: ``` Action:<action number> ```. Include one sentence of feedback on the action and your expectation to see if it aligns with the strategy. Notice, Action 0 will not reasult in any change in this game environment, and you may need to understand the level layout first to play the game. 

=== Sprite Mapping ===
avatar -> 'a'
background dirt -> '.'
background -> '-'
background exitdoor -> 'e'
background boulder -> 'o'
background diamond -> 'x'
background crab -> 'c'
background butterfly -> 'b'
boulder -> '@'
butterfly -> '#'
crab -> '$'
diamond -> '%'
dirt -> '&'
exitdoor -> '*'
wall -> 'b'
sword -> 'd'
diamond sword -> 'w'
boulder sword -> 'f'

===Long-term Plan===
```**avatar strategy: Instead of attempting ineffective directional movement, deploy the sword to dissolve adjoining dirt, thereby creating an unobstructed passage that unlocks access to a resource-rich diamond zone and aligns the avatar safely with the exitdoor—ensuring avoidance of crabs and missteps while advancing the level** with **Alert**```

Action:1

I'm using the sword to clear the dirt tile immediately to my right (row8, col23), expecting to open a path toward the diamond zone safely.
